Class Collage

java.lang.Object
  Collage

public class Collage
extends java.lang.Object

A collage is a collection of Fragments. Its methods create and modify a collage.

Version:
(6 April 2014)
Author:
(Shaun Leong (20753794))

Constructor Detail

Collage

public Collage()
Construct a new Collage object. This method constructs an Arraylist of Fragment class for the varialbe collage

Method Detail

addFragment

public void addFragment(Fragment f)
Add a new Fragment (line) to the collage.

Parameters:
f - Fragment to add this method adds a fragment of class Fragment to the collage arraylist

countKeys

public int countKeys(java.lang.String key)
Count number of images whose keywords include the substring key.

Parameters:
key - String, the substring to search for
Returns:
count int of number of qualifying images

explode

public void explode(double scale)
Scale the collage (relative to 0,0) by moving each image to a new position and scaling the image size.

Parameters:
scale - double where less than one means shrink and more than one means expand the collage

findFragment

public Fragment findFragment(java.lang.String key)
Find a Fragment whose name includes key. This method could be used e.g. to select colors for making tile pictures. Optional extension: return any one of the matching fragments chosen at random, not just the first one.

Parameters:
key - String to search for
Returns:
Fragment the first that matches this key

getAllKeywords

public java.lang.String getAllKeywords()
Make a newline separated string of all keywords in the collage excluding any duplicates. Optional extension: use substrings of keywords when searching for duplicates (and write JUnit test cases for that)

Returns:
String of Fragment keywords

getFragment

public Fragment getFragment(int i)
Get the Fragment at position i.

Parameters:
i - int the position of the Fragment object
Returns:
Fragment object at position i

makeTiles

public void makeTiles(int tileWidth,
                      int tileHeight)
Set every fragment in the collage to have size tileWidth by tileHeight.

Parameters:
tileWidth - new int x-size for the Fragment
tileHeight - new int y-size for the Fragment

maxX

public int maxX()
Find largest x position in the collage, assuming that the Collage has at least one Fragment.

Returns:
int maximum x-value of any Fragment

maxY

public int maxY()
Find largest y position in the collage, assuming that the Collage has at least one Fragment.

Returns:
int maximum y-value of any Fragment

minX

public int minX()
Find smallest x position in the collage, assuming that the Collage has at least one Fragment.

Returns:
int minimum x-value of any Fragment

minY

public int minY()
Find smallest y position in the collage, assuming that the Collage has at least one Fragment.

Returns:
int minimum y-value of any Fragment

move

public void move(int xDelta,
                 int yDelta)
Move every fragment in the collage by a given amount.

Parameters:
xDelta - int pixels of horizontal move
yDelta - int pixels of vertical move

numberOfFragments

public int numberOfFragments()
Get the size of the collage.

Returns:
int the number of Fragments in the Collage

removeRandom

public void removeRandom()
Choose any one of the fragments in the collage at random and remove it from the collage.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Generate a human readable summary of the features of the collage. Format the string as you wish with your own choice of information. e.g. you can include information such as the number of Fragments, bounding box co-ordinates, and keywords used.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
String summarising the features of the collage.
